qas.question: What book did Gaddafi publish that detailed his Third Internal Theory?
What was Gaddafi's first position in government?

answers.text: Chairman of the governing Revolutionary Command Council

qas.question: As Chairman of the RCC, list the first two things that Gaddafi accomplished.

answers.text: abolished the monarchy and proclaimed the Republic

qas.question: How did Gaddafi change the legal system?

answers.text: he introduced sharia as the basis for the legal system

qas.question: How did Gaddafi use all the money that resulted from nationalizing the oil industry?

answers.text: to bolster the military, implement social programs and fund revolutionary militants across the world.
formation of General People's Committees (GPCs), purported to be a system of direct democracy, but retained personal control over major decisions

qas.question: When Gaddafi established his power in the government, what were his first actions?

answers.text: abolished the monarchy and proclaimed the Republic

qas.question: What political ideology did Gaddafi want to push his country to?
What was the profession of Gaddafi's father?
In what city was the Royal Military Academy located?
From what monarch did Gaddafi's movement take over Libya?
What was the name of the governing body headed by Gaddafi after the revolution?

context: The son of an impoverished <a9_0>Bedouin<a9_0/> <a8_0>goat herder<a8_0/>, Gaddafi became involved in politics while at school in Sabha, subsequently enrolling in the Royal Military Academy, <a10_0>Benghazi<a10_0/>. Founding a revolutionary cell within the military, in 1969 they seized power from the absolute monarchy of King <a11_0>Idris<a11_0/> in a bloodless coup. Becoming <a1_0>Chairman of the governing <a12_0>Revolutionary Command Council<a12_0/><a1_0/> (RCC), Gaddafi <a2_0><a6_0>abolished the monarchy and proclaimed the Republic<a6_0/><a2_0/>. Ruling by decree, he implemented measures to remove what he viewed as foreign imperialist influence from Libya, and strengthened ties to Arab nationalist governments. Intent on pushing Libya towards "<a7_0>Islamic socialism<a7_0/>", <a3_0>he introduced sharia as the basis for the legal system<a3_0/> and nationalized the oil industry, using the increased revenues <a4_0>to bolster the military, implement social programs and fund revolutionary militants across the world.<a4_0/> In 1973 he initiated a "Popular Revolution" with the <a5_0>formation of General People's Committees (GPCs), purported to be a system of direct democracy, but retained personal control over major decisions<a5_0/>. He outlined his Third International Theory that year, publishing these ideas in <a0_0>The Green Book<a0_0/>.
